HTTPHeadersUpgrade.summary: The HTTP 1.1 (only) Upgrade header can be used to upgrade an already established client/server connection to a different protocol (over the same transport protocol). For example, it can be used by a client to upgrade a connection from HTTP 1.1 to HTTP 2.0, or an HTTP or HTTPS connection into a WebSocket.

blockquote.para: Warning: HTTP/2 explicitly disallows the use of this mechanism/header; it is specific to HTTP/1.1.

remarks.para:
-Protocol upgrade mechanism
-{{HTTPStatus("101")}} Switching Protocol
-{{HTTPStatus("426")}} Upgrade Required
-Connection
